solution_line_template: John wants to buy {num_chips_packets} packets of chips, which will cost him {num_chips_packets} * {chips_price_per_packet} = $<<{num_chips_packets}*{chips_price_per_packet}={chips_total_cost}>>{chips_total_cost}.
So John would have {john_total_money} - {chips_total_cost} = $<<{john_total_money}-{chips_total_cost}={money_left}>>{money_left} left for the corn chips.
John could buy for the rest of the money {money_left} / {corn_chips_price_per_packet} = <<{money_left}/{corn_chips_price_per_packet}={corn_chips_packets}>>{corn_chips_packets} packets of corn chips.
